entry.title: Memories
entry.summary:
Author: westfl4sh

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,042Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 15

Summary: Bruce Wayne spends his life believing that love is a dangerous luxury, something that weakens, distracts, and kills. Still, against all logic, he loves Clark Kent. Clark sees. Always sees. He recognizes the care hidden in rigid rules, the affection in silences, the loneliness beneath the armor. And he loves Bruce completely, even when Bruce pretends he doesn‚Äôt need to be loved. These are the memories Bruce carries.

entry.title: The Icarus to Your Certainty
entry.summary:
Author: roaringly

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,318Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 31

Summary: That night, Bruce prayed quietly in his own head, staring blankly at the gray wall his bed was tucked against. He felt warm, wet tears fall from his eyes and soaking the pillow beneath him. Alfred sat sleeping in the rocking chair next to him, his hand draped weakly over Bruce‚Äôs back in comfort. Can you hear me, God? Please, answer. He was only met with a deafening silence in return, with accents like the buzz of the ceiling fan and the gentle sound of Alfred‚Äôs breathing piercing through it, and Bruce never prayed again after that. He saw no need to. God wasn‚Äôt real. Gods weren‚Äôt real. At least that‚Äôs what he thought until Clark entered his life.

entry.title: And Now It Follows Me Everyday
entry.summary:
Author: theFamousLivingDead

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 31,189Chapters: 10/?Kudos: 57

Summary: Gotham has a reputation that precedes itself, but these days even her city limits are overrun with chaos. The streets are littered with rumors about a new shape above the skyline. The docks have been taken over by gangs and civilians are forced to keep to a curfew for their own safety. Bruce Wayne is stumped when all his attempts to prevent crime from taking off in Gotham are thwarted by a lightningfast shadow. His worst nightmare comes true -- there is someone else out there, more powerful than he could ever train himself to be, and he's not on his side of history. In which Clark Kent went out to find more about himself and his origins, but the League of Assassins found him first.

entry.title: Turn This Manor into a Home!
entry.summary:
Author: jerrys_21_sided_die

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,025Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 7

Summary: For as long as Bruce can (or chooses) to remember, Wayne Manor has been empty. After Alfred gets fed up with his macho ‚ÄúI‚Äôm Batman I don‚Äôt need anyone but the night.‚Äù attitude he sends Bruce to Haly‚Äôs circus to unwind; but thats not what happens, Bruce watches two performers fall to their deaths as their 7 year old son watches. Bruce decides right there and then he won‚Äôt let Richard become one of the children lost to Gothams foster care system. Along the way a reporter from the Daily Planet catches wind of this ordeal, as he interviews Richard (with the help of Bruce) he starts to linger more and more around Wayne Manor. As introverted as Bruce is, he likes the reporters company, Richard‚Äôs little feet pattering around the manor, and the dinner outings the trio go on every Friday. They make this house (or mansion) a home.
